STUDY_ID.x-description: Unique participant identifier in the Generations Study. Present in all source datasets as CancerRegistry.STUDY_ID, FlaggingCancers.StudyID, HistoPath_BrCa.StudyID, and HistoPath_OvCa.StudyID. Values are identical across sources and serve as the primary key to link records between datasets. No transformation or source prioritisation required.

TUMOUR_ID.description: Unique identifier for each tumour (one participant may have several).
TUMOUR_ID.x-description: Tumour-specific identifier. A participant may have multiple tumours, each with its own TUMOUR_ID. Provided directly in CancerRegistry.TUMOURID or FlaggingCancers.TumourID. Pathology datasets (HistoPath_BrCa, HistoPath_OvCa) do not include a universal tumour ID, only tumour-level details (e.g., count, site, laterality, size, grade, stage). When integrating, use CancerRegistry.TUMOURID (or FlaggingCancers.TumourID if registry ID is unavailable) as the primary source. Link pathology tumours to registry/flagging tumours when the pathology DATEKEY (best pathology date: DateSpecimenTaken → DateSpecimenReceived) is within ±90 days of the registry diagnosis date (DIAGNOSISDATEBEST) or flagging diagnosis date, and site/laterality/morphology are compatible. If pathology tumours cannot be linked, generate a synthetic ID in the format SYN-{STUDY_ID}-{DATEKEY}-{SITE3}-{LAT}-{SEQ}, where SITE3 is ICD-10 3-char (or UNK), LAT is laterality (L|R|M|B|U), and SEQ is a 2-digit sequence per participant/date/site/side. Group pathology records into one tumour if within 90 days, same site/laterality, and morphology-compatible. If an official ID later becomes available, replace the synthetic ID and maintain a lookup table that records the relationship between the two identifyers .

DIAGNOSIS_DATE.description: Best estimate of tumour diagnosis date (per tumour).
DIAGNOSIS_DATE.x-description: Best estimate of the tumour diagnosis date (YYYY-MM-DD). Each participant may have multiple diagnosis dates, one per distinct tumour (TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.DIAGNOSISDATEBEST; 2) Pathology reports — for breast use HistoPath_BrCa in this order: Coredat, DateSpecimenTaken, DateSpecimenReceived, ReportDat; for ovarian use HistoPath_OvCa in the same order: Coredat, DateSpecimenTaken, DateSpecimenReceived, ReportDat; 3) FlaggingCancers.DCancer;

AGE_AT_DIAGNOSIS.description: Age of the patient when they were diagnosed with the tumour in years. (per tumour).
AGE_AT_DIAGNOSIS.x-description: Age in whole years at diagnosis, calculated separately for each tumour (TUMOUR_ID) only if not available in CancerRegistry.AGE. Derived as floor((DIAGNOSIS_DATE – CancerRegistry.BIRTHDATEBEST) / 365.25).

ICD_CODE.description: ICD-10-O2 site code (4-character) for tumour site.
ICD_CODE.x-description: Primary ICD-10-O2 site code (4-character) describing the site of origin of the neoplasm. Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.SITE_ICD10_O2 ("Describes site of origin of the neoplasm"); 2) FlaggingCancers.CancerICD ("Cancer ICD code"). Use the code as provided by the source without recoding. This field is per tumour (TUMOUR_ID).

ICD_CODE_3CHAR.x-description: Three-character ICD-10-O2 site code describing the site of origin of the neoplasm. Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.SITE_ICD10_O2_3CHAR (preferred, standard ICD-10-O2); 2) CancerRegistry.SITE_CODED_3CHAR (fallback for legacy/compatibility); 3) Derived as the first three characters of ICD_CODE (from CancerRegistry.SITE_ICD10_O2 or FlaggingCancers.CancerICD). Null if not available.

MORPH_CODE.x-description: ICD-O morphology code describing the histological type/behaviour of the tumour (as provided by the source; may include the behaviour suffix, e.g., "/2", "/3"). Per tumour (TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.MORPH_ICD10_O2 (preferred); 2) CancerRegistry.MORPH_CODED (fallback); 3) HistoPath_BrCa.ICDMorphologyCode. Store the code exactly as provided (no recoding).

HISTOLOGY_CODE.description: Histology code - combines the morphology and behaviour codes.
HISTOLOGY_CODE.x-description: ICD-O Histology code describing the combination of morphology and behaviour of the tumour (as provided by the source; may include the behaviour suffix, e.g., "/2", "/3"). Per tumour (TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.HISTOLOGY_CODED (preferred); 2)FlaggingCancers.Histology. Store the code exactly as provided (no recoding).

SITE.description: Text description of anatomical site (from registry or pathology).
SITE.x-description: Text description of anatomic site.  Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.SITE_CODED_DESC; 2) For ovarian cancers only, HistoPath_OvCa.Primary_Site; else null.

GRADE.description: Tumour histological grade (harmonised, per registry coding).
GRADE.x-description: Tumour histological grade (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) For breast: HistoPath_BrCa.InvasiveGrade, mapped to Cancer Registry format (InvasiveGrade 1→G1, 2→G2, 3→G3); 2) For ovarian: HistoPath_OvCa.Grade_I_II_III, mapped to Cancer Registry format (I→G1, II→G2, III→G3); 3) CancerRegistry.GRADE (retain registry codes exactly: GX, G0–G7, GL/GH/GI/G) if pathology grade is not available. All pathology- and registry-derived values must be harmonised into the Cancer Registry coding system; pathology values take precedence when present.
enumDescriptions: GX : Grade of differentiation is not appropriate or cannot be assessed

TUMOUR_SIZE.x-description: Largest tumour dimension in millimetres (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) Pathology: Breast (HistoPath_BrCa.SizeInvasiveTumour; if invasive size missing and DCIS only, use HistoPath_BrCa.SizeDCISOnly). 2) CancerRegistry.TUMOURSIZE. Pathology values take precedence when available; record numeric size only, null if text/ambiguous.

NODES_TOTAL.x-description: Total number of local/regional lymph nodes examined (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) Breast pathology: HistoPath_BrCa.AxillaryNodesTotal + HistoPath_BrCa.OtherNodesTotal (sum; treat nulls as 0 only if at least one component is non-null); 2) CancerRegistry.NODESINVOLVED — described in the registry schema as the "number of local and regional nodes examined." Ovarian pathology does not provide node counts. Store as an integer; null if unavailable.

NODES_POSITIVE.description: Number of lymph nodes positive for metastasis.
NODES_POSITIVE.x-description: Number of local/regional lymph nodes positive for metastasis (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) Breast pathology: HistoPath_BrCa.AxillaryNodesPositive + HistoPath_BrCa.OtherNodesPositive (sum; treat nulls as 0 only if at least one component is non-null); 2) CancerRegistry.NODESEXCISED — described in the registry schema as the "number of local and regional nodes reported as being positive." Ovarian pathology does not provide node counts. Store as an integer; null if unavailable.

STAGE.x-description: Best tumour stage at diagnosis (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.STAGE_BEST. Pathology-derived staging takes precedence when available; all values must be expressed in the Cancer Registry coding system.; 2) Pathology staging (Breast: HistoPath_BrCa.Tstage, HistoPath_BrCa.NStage, HistoPath_BrCa.Mstage; Ovarian: HistoPath_OvCa.Stage_Best or FIGO if available), mapped to Cancer Registry stage format;

ER_STATUS.x-description: Oestrogen receptor (ER) status (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.ER_Status (map NP → X; retain P/N; map borderline if present to B); 2) CancerRegistry.ER_STATUS (retain registry codes: P/N/B/X/U). Pathology values take precedence when available; all values must be expressed in the Cancer Registry coding system.

PR_STATUS.x-description: Progesterone receptor (PR) status (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.PR_Status (map NP → X; retain P/N; map borderline if present to B); 2) CancerRegistry.PR_STATUS (retain registry codes: P/N/B/X/U). Pathology values take precedence when available; all values must be expressed in the Cancer Registry coding system.

HER2_STATUS.x-description: HER2 receptor status (harmonised to Cancer Registry coding). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.HER2_Status (map NP → X; retain P/N/B); 2) CancerRegistry.HER2_STATUS (retain registry codes: P/N/B/X/U). If both IHC and FISH are available in pathology, use the definitive integrated result; pathology values take precedence when available; all values must be expressed in the Cancer Registry coding system.

Ki67.description: Ki67 proliferation index (% positive nuclei, breast only).
Ki67.x-description: Ki67 proliferation index (% of tumour nuclei positive, recorded as an integer 1–100). Source: HistoPath_BrCa.Ki67 only. Pathology values are stored as-is; record as a numeric percentage without the % sign. Null if not reported. Each value is per tumour (TUMOUR_ID).

SCREEN_DETECTED.x-description: Whether the tumour was detected via a screening programme. Source priority: 1) CancerRegistry.FINAL_ROUTE — set 'Y' if FINAL_ROUTE = 'Screening'; set 'N' if FINAL_ROUTE = any non-screening route; set '9' if unknown. 2) HistoPath_BrCa.ScreenDetected (Y/N/NK → map NK to '9'). Allowed values: 'Y' (Yes), 'N' (No), '8' (Not applicable), '9' (Not known).

LATERALITY.description: Side of body affected (left, right, bilateral, unknown).
LATERALITY.x-description: Laterality of the tumour (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.Side (map L/R as-is, U → '9'); 2) CancerRegistry.LATERALITY (retain registry codes: L, R, M, B, 8, 9). Pathology values take precedence when available; harmonise all values to registry coding.

T_STAGE.x-description: Tumour TNM T stage (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.Tstage; 2) CancerRegistry.T_BEST. Pathology values take precedence when available; harmonise to Cancer Registry coding. For ovarian cancers, use STAGE rather than TNM.

N_STAGE.x-description: Tumour TNM N stage (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.NStage; 2) CancerRegistry.N_BEST. Pathology values take precedence when available; harmonise to Cancer Registry coding. For ovarian cancers, use STAGE rather than TNM.

M_STAGE.x-description: Tumour TNM M stage (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source priority: 1) HistoPath_BrCa.Mstage; 2) CancerRegistry.M_BEST. Pathology values take precedence when available; harmonise to Cancer Registry coding. For ovarian cancers, use STAGE rather than TNM.

SOURCE.description: Data sources used for tumour record.
SOURCE.x-description: Audit trail of data sources used for this tumour record. For each variable, record the source dataset (e.g., Registry, Pathology_BrCa, Pathology_OvCa, Flagging). At the record level, summarise as a comma-separated list of unique sources. Multiple sources may apply.

DATE_CREATED.description: Date the casummary record was created.
DATE_CREATED.x-description: Timestamp (YYYY-MM-DD or date-time) when this casummary record was created. Set by the integration process; not sourced from clinical data.

COMMENTS.x-description: Free-text notes about data integration decisions or anomalies for this tumour record.

STAGE_FIGO.x-description: FIGO stage at diagnosis (ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal tumours only; per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source: HistoPath_OvCa.Stage_FIGO (pathology-only). Store verbatim as reported (e.e., I, IA–IC, II, IIIA–IIIC, IV, IVA–IVB). Null for non-ovarian tumours. If multiple pathology records exist for the same tumour episode, use the most definitive value from within the 90-day grouping window. This field is not harmonised to registry STAGE; it complements STAGE.

BENIGN_TUMOUR.description: Indicator if ovarian tumour was benign (0 = No, 1 = Yes).
BENIGN_TUMOUR.x-description: Indicator of whether the ovarian tumour was benign (per tumour, TUMOUR_ID). Source: HistoPath_OvCa.Benign_Tumour. Type: number or null. Expected coding: 0 = No, 1 = Yes; null if not applicable. Variable only applies to ovarian tumours; null for breast and other sites.
